question: How would you say communication has changed compared to the past?
transcript: Definitely social media. It plays a huge role in it. Obviously, in the last couple years, there is more and more social media and more and more people on it. So, I think that is changed the most. you know, people used to be more face to face talking and now you are talking on social media a lot more. it is changed a lot in that way.

grammar.why_not_7: Correct use of 'used to' and present perfect.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.

vocab_reason: Observation: 'Plays a huge role'. Impact: Precise. Justification: **Sufficient range** meets Band 8.
grammar_reason: Observation: 'Used to be'. Impact: Clear. Justification: **Majority error-free** meets Band 8.

question: What is your favorite hobby and how often do you do it?
transcript: My favorite hobby, I would have to say in the summertime would definitely be golfing. I love getting out on the golf course. it is beautiful out there, very relaxing. it is it is great to do. In the winter time, I would say snowboarding would be my favorite. I do not get out as much as I would like to, but it is one of my favorite things to do.

vocab_evidence: getting out on the golf course

grammar.why_not_7: Uses 'Not as much as I would like to' accurately.

question: Have your hobbies changed since, childhood?

question: How do you think they have changed?
transcript: I think just growing older, you know, things change. obviously as a child, you have a lot of different friends, a lot different interests. You know, everyone wants to grow up and be a professional soccer player, but at the end of the day, not everyone can do that. So, I I think just getting older, maturing has changed them for the most part.

question: Why do people help strangers?
transcript: I think it is to almost make themselves feel good at some point. everyone likes, you know, trying to offer someone some help and it definitely makes yourself and and make yourself look good. it is not always easy, but I I think that is why people do it. Self-gratitude. I think that is why.

question: Do you think people today are less willing to help others compared to maybe people in the past?
transcript: I think so. I think in the past people were brought up on the I help you, you help me. I think things are a little divided nowadays and not everyone's willing to help everyone. I think that should change. But going back to your question, yes, I do think it is different from the past from now.

question: Should children be taught to help others?
transcript: Children should definitely be taught to help others. obviously from a young age, they are very influenced by all their peers and adults. They should be taught how to treat people right and how to talk to people and and how to help people they do not know and just general things.

grammar.why_not_9: Ending 'and just general things' drifts off.

question: Do you think large organizations or individuals have a bigger responsibility to help society?
transcript: I think they do. they are playing a huge role in people's lives nowadays. for sure. And they have huge platforms that they should be using for the better to help those people. I think that is the best way to best way to put that. They should be more influenced on everyone else and trying to help everyone else. They have a big a big voice. they should definitely be using it.

anti_overrating.reason: 'Influenced on' is incorrect. Heavy repetition of 'huge'/'big'.

vocabulary.why_not_9: Repetition of 'huge', 'big' and error 'influenced on' (should be 'influential'?).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common items with some awareness of style and collocation, with some inappropriate choices.

vocab_reason: Observation: 'Influenced on' (error), 'big voice' (good metaphor), repetitive 'huge'. Impact: Clear but less precise. Justification: **Occasional inaccuracies** suggests Band 7/8 border. Will give 8 for 'platforms', 'voice'.
grammar_reason: Observation: Structure is solid. Impact: Clear. Justification: **Majority error-free** allows Band 8.

question: In your opinion, does helping others always make a difference?
transcript: It does not always make a difference. No. not everyone's willing to accept the help or wants to help. but all you can do is try as a human being. that is that is all you can do. it is a it is a difficult one for sure, but everyone needs a little bit of respect and trying to help them out. I think that is the right thing to do, but not everyone's willing to do that.

question: Where is your hometown?
transcript: My hometown is Tehran. I was born in Terran, akatan town and I am kind of used to living there because all my childhood friends are there. I used to play in the playgrounds and I remember that my mother and father used to take me there and I had so many friends I had so many friends back there but unfortunately now I do not live there anymore.

grammar.why_not_7: 'Used to' used correctly, but flow is Band 6/7 level.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Uses a mix of simple and complex structures, but with limited flexibility.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Has a wide enough vocabulary to discuss topics at length and make meaning clear.

grammar_reason: Observation: 'Used to play', 'kind of used to'. Impact: Accurate. Justification: **Mix of structures** meets Band 6.

question: When do you usually get up in the morning?
transcript: I usually get up early in the morning but it can change whether I have a whether I have homework or not because because my because of my major which is arch which is architecture. our homework is various and we can we can either have a lot of homework or not at all.

grammar.why_not_9: Hesitations and self-correction ('because my because of my').

question: So do you usually have the same routine every day?
transcript: No I do not usually have the same routine every day. as I told you before because of my major which is architecture we have various homeworks and I study different languages which which are architecture, Korean and English. So so based on these facts I have different daily routines and different plans every day.

question: Now, is your routine the same today as it was when you were a child?

question: And what do you use dictionaries for?
